result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Joe Bigboy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations added to payment plan. $25 per month beginning 1/5/17 and increasing to $50 per month 3/5/17
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment.

Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.
  Def to obtain domestic abuse/perpetrators counseling as directed and complete recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
Defendant may go to convenience/grocery stores even if alcohol is sold there. 
May be present where alcohol is sold/served soley for seeking or maintaining employment. 
Not to possess Prescriptions except for those prescribed to him.
Defendant to advise DOC what medication(s) are prescribed to him.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
NO FACE TO FACE CONTACT WITH CARISSA DEPERRY. Defendant may have electronic/telephonic/written contact for purposes of child care.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Work Release.
Granted Child Care Release.
Granted Good Time.
Concurrent with: Each count
Financial obligations as previously ordered to be paid through the Clerk of Courts Office and a civil judgment is entered. Payment paln $25 per month beginning 1/3/18.

Atty Latzig stipulates this agreement and the CTS.  17CF189 Rec copy of compl, waives reading, waives right to prelim, ct finds probable cause, case bound over, information provided to Atty Latzig. Argn waives reading, plea NG.
16CM66 state has complied with victim rights, no response. Judgment each count 210 days concurrent CTS 55 days, work release, child care release, good time. Financial obligations civil judgment collected by COC. $25 per month beginning 1/3/18.
